title: The state of Schleswig-Holstein is consistently relying on open source
author: doener
aiHeadline: Goodbye, Microsoft! Schleswig-Holstein saves millions by embracing open-source software and proving that you don't need expensive proprietary solutions to run a state.

title: Over fifty new hallucinations in ICLR 2026 submissions
author: puttycat
aiHeadline: ICLR 2026 submissions are getting weirder by the day, with over fifty new hallucinations that will make you question reality itself. AI researchers are clearly having too much fun with their models.

title: Google Titans architecture, helping AI have long-term memory
author: Alifatisk
aiHeadline: Google's new Titans architecture is giving AI the long-term memory it always deserved. Now, your chatbot can remember your preferences for months—because who needs privacy when you have persistence?

title: Z2 – Lithographically fabricated IC in a garage fab
author: embedding-shape
aiHeadline: Meet Z2, the latest in DIY electronics: a lithographically fabricated IC created in a garage. Because why have a factory when you can have a garage full of circuit boards and ambition?

title: I failed to recreate the 1996 Space Jam website with Claude
author: thecr0w
aiHeadline: In a surprising twist, someone failed to recreate the 1996 Space Jam website using Claude. Apparently, even AI can't bring back the glory days of Geocities and animated GIFs.
